vulnerability.name: USN-4737-2
vulnerability.description: USN-4737-1 fixed a vulnerability in Bind. This update provides the corresponding update for Ubuntu 12.04 ESM and Ubuntu 14.04 ESM.  Original advisory details:   It was discovered that Bind incorrectly handled GSSAPI security policy  negotiation. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause Bind to crash,  resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code. In  the default installation, attackers would be isolated by the Bind AppArmor  profile.

statements.status_notes: Bind could be made to crash or run programs if it received specially crafted network traffic. Available with Ubuntu Pro.
